text: Neu5Ac seems to be responsible for inducing the conformational change of Ile327 . Cp - NanI CD in complex with diplacone has the same side - chain orientation of Asp291 as in the substrate ( Neu5Ac ) complex . In addition , an extra water molecule ( W1 ) rather than the 4 0 - hydroxyl group of Neu5Ac stabilizes the diplacone complex . Therefore , together with the kinetic inhibition assay , the structure of the Cp - NanI CDdiplacone complex suggests that diplacone binds to the same substrate - binding site and acts as a competitive inhibitor .
